desmoj.core.simulator

Class Scheduler

  • java.lang.Object
    • desmoj.core.simulator.NamedObject
      • desmoj.core.simulator.Scheduler

  • public class Scheduler
extends NamedObject
    The scheduler is the main element controlling the run of a simulation. It controls the event-list in which all scheduled events are stored, picks the next event to be processed and advances the simulation clock accordingly.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected SimClock clock
      The actual simulation clock for this scheduler.
      protected EventList evList
      The event-list used by the scheduler.
      protected Experiment myExperiment
      The experiment this scheduler serves.
      protected boolean simulationFinished
      Flag to indicate whether the current simulation is running or stopped.

    • Field Detail

      • myExperiment

        protected Experiment myExperiment
        The experiment this scheduler serves.

      • clock

        protected SimClock clock
        The actual simulation clock for this scheduler.

      • evList

        protected EventList evList
        The event-list used by the scheduler.

      • simulationFinished

        protected boolean simulationFinished
        Flag to indicate whether the current simulation is running or stopped. If true, the simulation is stopped, if false, the simulation is still running. This flag is especially polled by processes exiting any synchronized method used for passivating the process thus giving control back to the scheduler.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Scheduler

        public Scheduler(Experiment exp,
                 java.lang.String name,
                 EventList eventList)
        Constructs a scheduler with given name and the event-list (i.e. inheritor of desmoj.core.simulator.EventList) to use.
        Parameters:
        exp - Experiment : The experiment that uses this Scheduler
        name - java.lang.String : The scheduler's name
        eventList - EventList : The event-list to store scheduled events

    • Method Detail

      • presentTime

        protected TimeInstant presentTime()
        Returns the actual simulation time as displayed by the simulation clock.
        Returns:
        TimeInstant : The current point in simulation time

      • getCurrentEntity

        protected Entity getCurrentEntity()
        Returns the currently active Entity. Returns null if the current Schedulable happens to be an external event or a simprocess. Note that in case the current Event refers to more than one entity (EventOfTwoEntities, EventOfThreeEntitties), only the first entity is returned; to obtain all such entities, use getAllCurrentEntities() instead.
        Returns:
        Entity : The currently active Entity or null in case of an external event or a simprocess being the currently active Schedulable

      • getAllCurrentEntities

        protected java.util.List<Entity> getAllCurrentEntities()
        Returns the currently active entities. Returns an empty list if the current Schedulable happens to be an external event or a SimProcess.
        Returns:
        List : A list containing the currently active entities

      • getCurrentEvent

        protected EventAbstract getCurrentEvent()
        Returns the current active Event or null. Note that this method can also return an external event that can not be handled like an Event since it does not support scheduling together with an entity. Returns null if the current Schedulable happens to be a Sim-process that has been activated, thus no kind of Event is associated with it.
        Returns:
        Event : The currently active Event or external event or null if the current Schedulable happens to be an activated SimProcess

      • getCurrentModel

        protected Model getCurrentModel()
        Returns the currently active model.
        Returns:
        Model : The currently active model or null in case of no model being connected so far.

      • getCurrentSource

        protected Schedulable getCurrentSource()
        Returns the Schedulable object that as created the current EventNode, thus being responsible for what is going on at the moment
        Returns:
        Schedulable : The source of the currently active object(s).
        See Also:
        Entity, SimProcess, ExternalEvent

      • getCurrentSchedulable

        protected Schedulable getCurrentSchedulable()
        Returns the currently active Schedulable object. This can be any of its subtypes Entity, SimProcess or external event in that order. For events referring to multiple enities, the first entity is returned.
        Returns:
        Schedulable : The currently active Schedulable
        See Also:
        Entity, SimProcess, ExternalEvent

      • getCurrentSimProcess

        protected SimProcess getCurrentSimProcess()
        Returns the current SimProcess. Note that this method can only return a Sim-process. If the currently active Schedulable is not instance of Sim-process or an external event, null is returned.
        Returns:
        SimProcess : The currently active SimProcess or null

      • getExecutionSpeedRate

        protected double getExecutionSpeedRate()
        Returns the current execution Speed Rate.
        Returns:
        double : The current execution speed rate.

      • getSimClock

        protected SimClock getSimClock()
        Returns the actual clock for this model.
        Returns:
        SimClock : The actual clock for simulation time

      • isRandomizingConcurrentEvents

        public boolean isRandomizingConcurrentEvents()
        Returns if the event-list processes concurrent Events in random order or not.
        Returns:
        boolean: true if concurrent Events are randomized, false otherwise

      • processNextEventNote

        protected boolean processNextEventNote()
        Processes the next event-note on the event-list. Returns true if that EventNote has been processed correctly, false if an error occurred or the event-list is empty.
        Returns:
        boolean : Is true if the next event-note was processed correctly, false if not

      • advanceTime

        protected void advanceTime(TimeInstant now,
                           TimeInstant next)
        This method is called to notify simulator about the time passed between the execution of two events with a positive (non-zero) offset. The implementation of this method just sets the scheduler's clock to the new instant; note, though, that extensions to DESMO-J may overwrite this method to conduct more complex operations, e.g. extrapolate variables in continuous simulation.
        Parameters:
        now - TimeInstant : The current point in simulation time
        next - TimeInstant : The next point in simulation time to advance the clock to (e.g. instant of the next event)

      • realTimeSchedule

        protected void realTimeSchedule(RealTimeEventWrapper what)
        Schedules the external event to happen at the simulation time equivalent to the current value of wall-clock time.
        Parameters:
        what - ExternalEvent : The external event to be scheduled

      • reSchedule

        protected void reSchedule(Schedulable who,
                          TimeSpan dt)
        Schedules the event to happen after a specified time. Checks that only legal combinations of valid parameters are scheduled.

        Valid scheduling types
        scheduling type
        		 Entity object Event object
        Event oriented Event or SimProcess Event
        process oriented SimProcess null
        external event null external event
        Parameters:
        who - Entity : The Entity to be scheduled
        dt - TimeSpan : The point in simulation time for the event to happen as an offset to the current simulation time

      • scheduleAfter

        protected void scheduleAfter(Schedulable after,
                             Entity who,
                             EventAbstract what)
        Schedules the given Entity and Event to happen straight after the given Schedulable is set to be activated. Note that the siulation time for the newly entered EventNote will be set to the Schedulable's time and the new EventNote will be inserted directly after the Schedulable's EventNote.

        Valid scheduling types
        scheduling type
        		 Entity object Event object
        Event oriented Event or SimProcess Event
        process oriented SimProcess null
        external event null external event
        Parameters:
        after - Schedulable : The Schedulable after which the new event-note is to be scheduled
        who - Entity : The Entity to be scheduled
        what - Event : The event to be scheduled

      • scheduleAfter

        protected void scheduleAfter(Schedulable after,
                             Entity who1,
                             Entity who2,
                             EventOf2Entities<?,?> what)
        Schedules the given Entity and Event to happen straight after the given Schedulable is set to be activated. Note that the siulation time for the newly entered EventNote will be set to the Schedulable's time and the new EventNote will be inserted directly after the Schedulable's EventNote.

        Valid scheduling types
        scheduling type
        		 Entity object Event object
        Event oriented Event or SimProcess Event

        external event null external event
        Parameters:

        who1 - Entity : The first entity to be scheduled
        who2 - Entity : The second entity to be scheduled
        what - EventOf2Entities : The event to be scheduled

      • scheduleBefore

        protected void scheduleBefore(Schedulable before,
                              Entity who,
                              EventAbstract what)
        Schedules the given Entity and Event to happen straight before the given Schedulable is scheduled. Note that the simulation time for the newly entered EventNote will be set to the Schedulable's time and the new EventNote will be inserted directly before the Schedulable's EventNote.

        Valid scheduling types
        scheduling type
        		 Entity object Event object
        Event oriented Event or SimProcess Event
        process oriented SimProcess null
        external event null external event
        Parameters:
        before - Schedulable : The Schedulable before which the new event-note is to be scheduled
        who - Entity : The Entity to be scheduled
        what - Event : The event to be scheduled

      • setExecutionSpeedRate

        protected void setExecutionSpeedRate(double executionSpeedRate)
        Sets the execution speed rate.
        Parameters:
        executionSpeedRate - double : the execution speed rate

      • setRandomizingConcurrentEvents

        protected void setRandomizingConcurrentEvents(boolean randomizing)
        Sets the flag indicating if the event-list processes concurrent Events in random order or not. If a change occurred the event-list has to be changed accordingly.
        Parameters:
        randomizing - boolean :true forces random order, false forces "linear" order

      • signalStop

        protected void signalStop()
        Signals that the experiment is stopped.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns a string representation of the current state of the event-list. The string is built by concatenating all string representations of the contained entities, events and TimeInstant objects calling their toString() methods.
        Overrides:
        toString in class NamedObject
        Returns:
        java.lang.String : The string representation of the queuelist
